intro: Sisymbrium acutangulum subsp. tillieri, commonly known as the Sierra wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, narrow linear leaves, and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodland or mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
